title: FIRST BLOOD: The Stats Behind The Slaughter

replies.body: Well written and nice graphics too {{champion:161}}

What about first blood combos? E.g Blitzcrank is unlikely to secure first blood (obviously) but he is instrumental in achieving it. The amount of times a Blitzcrank support jungle invade results in first blood is phenomenal. With some champions (I'm looking at supports), it would be more interesting to run the regression on first blood secured by the team with the support champion picked. This way we'd find out how often support x results in the team getting first blood rather than the (obviously low and not very useful info) of support x securing first blood themselves

As a support main, I'd like to see how much chance x support has of getting their adc first kill (blitz would be low, high chance of the blitz getting the first kill). Of course this assumes several things. A: Adc got kill, B: support was actually there and helping with it and C: junglers were not involved
What about teemo ?
Ranked games buddy, who plays teemo ranked? lol
Bronze? :^)
Funny :P plat/diamond teemo main and 10-0 teemo placements on smurf to get placed in gold :^)
You could be challenger if you played an actual champion.
Ok guys by these stats if at 20min we're 40 kills behind we still have an 80% chance of winning if we go take baron.
whole enemy team would have to disconnect simultaneously for you to get baron lol
It's an average across a variety of games, not saying that if you get baron you have an 80% chance.

> you’ve been able to bully their Ahri in lane.

Thats a possibility?
News to me.
I don't know how everyone else sees janna, but when I see her (low elo) she's often the one getting first bloods.
And that's where the 1.7% likely comes from.

I love this conclusion. Especially the bit about blitzcrank:
"Finally, if you give up first blood to that Blitzcrank spamming his mastery emote—sleep well. He’s not gonna do squat with it."
What is life

I would really like to see the FBR, and FBB statistics with 5% of the best games (as in the games with the most kills from the champion and highest gold difference between teams) and 5% of the worst games (the games with the champ feeding the most kills and against the highest gold difference between teams) omitted to give a better indication of champs true snowball potenial by cutting out the people who tend to feed and tilt when losing fb and vice versa. This is really interesting and I would love to see these stats applied to pro-play and not only analysed on champs but also players.
i main talon and and it is really true that he get 1st blood most of the time
